varieties.name: Castillo Lactofermented
varieties.description: Meticulously picked, a bold and playful cup, with sweet zesty acidity and layered notes of yogurt, red berries, and caramel after a meticulous 72-hour fermentation with carefully reproduced mirobiome from the farm. For a more traditional yet refined profile.

varieties.name: Castillo Washed
varieties.description: A Colombian flavor by excellence. It brings a balanced medium acidity with bright lime tones, rich chocolate, panela, and smooth caramel—a comforting cup rooted in heritage.

varieties.name: Gesha Washed
varieties.description: Grown at 1840 masl, reveals the elegance of the variety with delicate florals, silky body, and complex notes of jasmine, bergamot, and ripe red fruits, culminating in a refined, almost tea-like finish.

varieties.name: Pink Bourbon Washed
varieties.description: A tribute to genetic enhancement in Colombia. A coffee that adds another dimension with medium lime acidity and a vibrant combination of plum, sugarcane, and tart cranberries.

varieties.name: Castillo Double Alcoholic
varieties.description: Undergoing 48 hours in cherry and 60 hours in mucilage—delivers a layered experience with sparkling tropical acidity, hints of passionfruit and stone fruit, and a syrupy body that carries through to a lingering finish of spiced cocoa and sweet tamarind.
